snippet: The federal government started the new budget year with a higher deficit in October than a year ago, but the increase reflected quirks in the calendar rather than a deterioration in the budget outlook.
abstract: Treasury Dept reports federal government started new budget year with higher deficit in October than a year ago, but increase reflects quirks in calendar rather than deterioration in budget outlook; deficit in October was $121.7 billion, up $31.1 billion from a year ago.
lead_paragraph: The federal government started the new budget year with a higher deficit in October than a year ago, but the increase reflected quirks in the calendar rather than a deterioration in the budget outlook.

headline.main: U.S. Deficit Starts Budget Year Higher, but It’s Just a Quirk
headline.print_headline: U.S. Deficit Starts Budget Year Higher, but It’s Just a Quirk
